README.md
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 # Propeller Manager
2 
3 *do more with the Propeller*
4 
5 Propeller Manager is more than a download tool; it is a complete API and toolset for managing Propeller devices, no matter where they are.
6 
7 ## Design Goals
8 
9 
10 ### Single point of integration
11 
12 The primary focus of the Propeller Manager project is to provide a single point of integration for the Propeller.
13 
14 It will provide an abstraction layer that allows applications that consume this API to treat any hardware configuration as simply a list of devices, providing all of the hooks needed to interact with them in a productive way. Propeller Manager forms the basis for all of PropellerIDE's interaction with hardware, allowing a clear separation of concerns and simplifying it's code base considerably.
15 
16 Propeller Manager provides a simple API to build the Propeller into applications in a cross-platform and reliable way.
17 
18 ![](gfx/propellermanager_layers.png)
19 
20 ### Safe device access
21 
22 Propeller Manager will implement a state machine that prevents conflicts between long-running device operations and arbitrates simultaneous accesses from different parts of an application.
23 
24 ![](gfx/propellerdevice_state.png)
25 
26 ### Event-driven, object-oriented
27 
28 Propeller Manager will be easier than ever before to integrate into applications.
29 
30 ### Multi-protocol
31 
32 Propeller Manager will provide a framework for supporting multiple download protocols and I/O devices side-by-side, so Propeller Manager will give you a bird's eye view of your hardware at a glance, no matter what your configuration.
33 
34 ### Persistent sessions
35 
36 Propeller Manager opens your device when you say so and looks after it until you're finished.
37 
38 That means no more spurious resets, toggling the terminal controls, switching back and forth between windows, or multiple serial connections required. Finally, cross-platform debugging is easy with the Propeller.
39 
40 ## Usage
41 
42 #### `propman` command-line interface
43 
44 Propeller Manager includes a small utility to use it from the command-line.
45 
46 For the most basic use cases, simply pass a binary name to `propman` to download to RAM. `propman` will use the first or only device available in the system.
47 
48  propman Brettris.binary
49 
50 Include the `-w` option to write the program to EEPROM.
51 
52 For more complex use cases, get a list of available devices with `-l`.
53 
54  $ propman -l
55  /dev/ttyUSB0
56  /dev/ttyS0
57 
58 Use the `-d` option to download to a specific device.
59 
60  propman Brettris.binary -d /dev/ttyUSB0
61 
62 Get your `propman` version with `-v`.
63 
64  propman -v
65  Propeller Manager CLI 0.0.0
66 
67 Get more help with `-h`.
68 
69  Usage: propman [options] FILE
70 
71  A command-line wrapper to the Propeller Manager API
72  Copyright 2015 by Parallax Inc.
73 
74  Options:
75  -h, --help Displays this help.
76  -v, --version Displays version information.
77  -l, --list List available devices
78  -w, --write Write program to EEPROM
79  -d, --device <DEV> Device to program (default: first system device)
80  -p, --pin <PIN> Pin for GPIO reset
81 
82  Arguments:
83  file Binary file to download
84
